Excerpts Abstract The results of the paper partially extend previous works of Hu and Tao, and of Tao and Winkler. Introduction A positive constant determined by $l$ besides $\tau$ (possibly changing from line to line) is henceforth denoted by $C_l$.

We do not wish to give further physical motivations for the present analysis and address the reader to Refs. [CLMP, Ki] and especially [ES, MP] for a more detailed presentation of the matter and additional references.
Before to do this let us recall that a domain A is strictly star-shaped if (modulo translations of the origin) there exists Î± > 0, such that $$ x \cdot v(x) \geqq \alpha>0 \quad \text { when } \quad x \in \partial \Lambda $$ where $v(x)$ is the outer normal to $\Lambda$ in $x$.
under a suitable smallness condition on the initial data, we show that solutions exist globally and converge exponentially to a constant.
An external chemoattractant source is provided in the form of a Dirac distribution scaled by some positive constant

The volume-filling approach provides an intuitive way into how density-dependent chemotactic mod- els may be realistically derived.
We have so far ignored the potential role of cell kinetics. This may be a reasonable modelling assumption for certain systems, for example during the aggregation stages of Dictyostelium discoideum when cell proliferation has halted, or if the time-scale of movement is significantly faster than that of cell growth.
